Items.Name: Hertz Corporation Bond Certificate 1970's
Items.Description: Scripophily Makes a Great Gift for Everyone Our Stocks are worth the paper they're printed on (sm) Our Company is a TRUSTED Buyer and Seller of Old Stock Certificates. Check out our About Me Page , where you can find out about us and read the recent articles about our company in Time Magazine, The Wall Street Journal, The Globe and Mail, Washington Post and our appearence on CNN. Beautifully engraved certificate from the Hertz Corporation issued in 1976-1977. This historic document was printed by the Security-Columbian Banknote Company and has an ornate border around it with a vignette of an allegorical man and woman sitting beside the company's logo. This item has the printed signatures of the company_s chairman (Robert L. Stone) and vice-president,finance and assistant secretary. This bond is over 34 years old. Hertz, the world's leading vehicle renting organization, is represented in over 140 countries, operating a fleet of 525,000 vehicles from approximately 6,500 locations. The pioneer of auto renting was Walter L. Jacobs who in September of 1918, at the age of 22, opened a car-rental operation in Chicago. Starting with a dozen Model T Fords, which he repaired and repainted himself, Jacobs expanded his operation to the point where, within five years, the business generated annual revenues of about $1 million. In 1923, Jacobs sold his car-rental concern to John Hertz, President of Yellow Cab and Yellow Truck and Coach Manufacturing Company. Jacobs continued as Hertz' top operating and administrative executive. This rental business, called Hertz Drive-Ur-Self System, was acquired in 1926 by General Motors Corporation when it bought Yellow Truck from John Hertz. The Hertz Corporation In 1953, the Hertz properties were bought from GMC by the Omnibus Corporation, which divested itself of its bus interest and concentrated solely on car and truck renting and leasing. A year later, a new name was taken -- The Hertz Corporation -- and it was listed for the first time on the New York Stock Exchange. Jacobs became Hertz' first President and served in that post until his retirement in 1960. He died in 1985 at the age of 88. In 1954, the new corporation bought Metropolitan Distributors, a pioneer in New York truck leasing dating back to World War I and the largest concern of its kind in any one city. In the process, the head of Metropolitan, Leon C. Greenbaum, became Vice Chairman of the Hertz Board of Directors; he later became Chairman, and in 1960, Chief Executive Officer. In 1967, The Hertz Corporation became a wholly owned subsidiary of RCA Corporation and operated as a separate entity, with its own management and Board of Directors. In 1985, Hertz joined UAL, Inc. On December 30, 1987, Hertz was sold to Park Ridge Corporation, a company formed by Ford Motor Company and Hertz management, for the purpose of purchasing Hertz. In 1988, Volvo North America Corporation joined Ford and Hertz management as an investor in Park Ridge Corporation. In 1993, Park Ridge Corporation was merged into The Hertz Corporation. In 1994, Ford purchased the outstanding shares of Hertz and Hertz became an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of The Ford Motor Company. On April 25, 1997, Hertz became a publicly traded company, listed on the New York Stock Exchange, under the symbol "HRZ." Hertz Today Hertz is headquartered in Park Ridge, New Jersey. Its current headquarters location opened in 1988. Prior to that the corporation was based in New York and, before that, Chicago. Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, is the site of Hertz' Worldwide Reservations Center and Data Center, established in 1970, and its Financial Center, established in 1994. Car rentals, the largest and best known of Hertz' activities, are conducted from more than 1,600 domestic, corporate and licensee locations, and approximately 4,500 corporate and licensee locations outside the United States. Hertz offers a wide variety of current-model cars on a short-term rental basis -- daily, weekly or monthly -- at airports, in downtown and suburban business centers, and in residential areas and resort locales. Today, Hertz' Worldwide Reservations System handles approximately 40 million phone calls and delivers in total approximately 30 million reservations annually This Authentic certificate looks great framed and is much nicer in person than the scan indicates. For further information about our auction item for sale, please click here or feel free to call our toll free number at 1-888-STOCKS6 or Direct at 703-787-3552. The certificate for sale will be the same in all material respects i.e. type, era, vignette, logo, etc. Don't stay awake suffering from Internet Auction ANGST , check out our Scripophily Auction Guarantee. We offer a 7 day no hassle satisfaction guarantee return policy in the event you are dissatisfied for any reason and a lifetime return policy if you find the item not to be authentic. To the best of our knowledge, everything we sell is 100% authentic and we do not sell reproductions of stock and bond certificates. There are not many companies who offer this type of guarantee in an auction. Our company has over 2,800 positive feedback comments on EBAY and we strive for 100% customer satisfaction. This will make a nice addition to your collection or a terrific historical gift for someone special. A $3.95 Priority Mail shipping charge(our cost in heavy cardboard envelope) to be paid by buyer for shipping within the United States. We will also ship anywhere in the world using Priority Mail and you will be charged our cost. If you buy other items from our auctions or web site, you only pay postage once if we mail everything together. We accept Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Paypal and Billpoint, checks and money orders. Please note that as with all of our certificates, we are not selling ownership interests or transferring any rights in the company, but we are selling an authentic stock certificate as a collectible. Our Company is a leader on the internet in buying, selling and researching collectible stock and bond certificates. We have been in business selling certificates for over 11 years. We are also members of The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, Washington Historical Autograph and Certificate Organization, Old Stock Exchange, EBAY Power Seller Program, Universal Autographs Collectors Club, and The International Bond and Share Society. Our Company is a name you can Trust. Contact auctions@Scripophily.com with Questions View some of our feedback on Ebay CLICK HERE! View our other auctions currently on Ebay CLICK HERE!

Items.Name: NEVADA ghost town bottle digging book, 1961
Items.Description: GREAT BOOK from the early heyday of bottle digging. This 55 page book by Adele Reed describes visits to 12 Nevada ghost towns and 4 California ghost towns, a description of what remained of the town and the bottles they dug in each town. It is autographed by the author. The Nevada towns included Goldfield, Virginia city, Sutro, Aurora, Belleville, Teel's Marsh, Candelaria, Belmont, Manhattan, Eureka, Austin,& Tonopah and the California towns included Mammoth City, Big Pine, Blind Springs Hill, & Bodie. There are drawings of the bottles they found at each site and a drawing of one of the remaining buildings. It is a truely interesting book with a little history thrown in. The book is 8 1/2" by 11" and while used the only damage is some water spots, wear and dirt on the cover. Buyer pays $1.50 shipping and checks require 10 days to clear.

Items.Name: William R. Hearst; Letter & Photo From Lady!
Items.Description: Letter to William Randolph Hearst at San Simeon, from someone signed "Maggie D." It appears the Mr. Hearst gave her a horse, but not the one she expected, and she is "upset"! It is dated, (1927). She sent him a photo of herself, with a haughty look and other "signs" that she is upset. This is a fascinating insight into a very mysterious man. I think this was probably from a family member, as he was dedicated to Marion davies at this time..(so I understand; he also was somewhat of a ladies man.) This is a unusual collectable. The picture is 8 1/4" by 10 1/4", and tinted. Items.Name: INDEPENDENDENCE HALL XMAS IN CITY DEPT 56
Items.Description: INDEPENDENDENCE HALL Christmas in The City, or for your HISTORICAL LANDMARK SERIES COLLECTION!! Introduced in 1998 and RETIRED in 2000 this replica of Philadelphia's Independence Hall was the first Historical Landmark not associated with England. First available during the 1999 July event. This is a Set of 2 which includes Hall and Sign. This is a very wonderful piece and a must for any collector of Snow Village, Christmas in The City or just the Historical Landmark Series. In dependence Hall was the backdrop for the most important events of America's early history. It was there that the Declaration of Independence was signed on July 4, 1776. It was from its steeple that the Liberty Bell rang out to celebrate the first public reading of the declaration four days later. You will find this piece in MINT condition in the original box and sleeve. This item will be extra well packed for shipping. There won't be another INDEPENDENDENCE HALL and when this one disapears it will be into someones collection making it even harder to find. Just a reminder: when Dept56 retires its buildings, shops and accessories THE MOLD IS BROKEN so there is no chance of that building, shop or accessory ever showing up again in the future for sale in a retail outlet. 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEED OR YOU CAN RETURN THE ITEM FOR A REPLACEMENT (if I have another) OR YOUR MONEY REFUNDED TO YOU IN FULL. Items.Name: Stone Print Play Billboard - Robinson Crusoe
Items.Description: Early 1900's Stone Print Theatrical Troupe Play Billboard Poster This Theatrical Poster Billboard is Stone Print Paper. It is 7 foot, 6 inches tall and 41 inches wide. Stone Print, Two Piece, Unused. Extraordinary Graphics! Close up of a small section This exceptional Robinson Crusoe poster was taken around by a "Front" man in advance of a traveling troop of actors who would go from town to town performing theatrical plays around the turn of the century. The Front man would write in with a crayon, or print on with a block printer, the time, place, and price details in the empty box at the top, then paste these to a wall or other appropriate place. Sometimes they went into frames in front of the Opera Houses or theaters that they were performing in. Predecessor to the movie poster! Phenomenal detail and coloring! Vivid colors, no fading! This has been rolled up in an old closet for over 80 years. The billboard poster is thick paper (not cardboard). It was rolled out on a sheet of wood and covered with transparent Storm Door window film. The reflection in the photos is from the transparent Storm Window Film that is stretched over the billboard. Click Here For Larger Photo We would send it rolled up in a tube. Would look sharp framed or wallpaper pasted to a wall. That is a 3 foot yardstick on the right side of photo. This is in Perfect Condition . Being sold to the highest bidder with no reserve. It's heavy, Buyer pays $3.95 actual Priority Mailing costs. Illinois residents pay 6.25% sales tax. Items.Name: "ONE TEAR AT A TIME" Video - Brand New!!
Items.Description: "ONE TEAR AT A TIME" TORN AND RESTORED CARD VIDEO! BRAND NEW! "One Tear At A Time" the ultimate torn and restored card by J.C. Wagner is a KILLER!!! Developed by the man who has had more influence than almost anyone else in magic on the Torn and Restored Card theme, J. C. Wagner, this is a practical and magical rendition of a classic card routine. Both the effect and the method are simple and direct! A card is selected and SIGNED along one edge. The card is then creased and torn into four VERY distinct pieces. Two of the pieces are put aside and the two remaining are visually and magically restored into one piece!! One of the remaining two pieces in now VISUALLY restored to the first two. The restorations are clean and beautiful to watch. With the last piece you get to see a J.C. presentation "Master Stroke" and why his creations are always tuned to the audience!! The last piece is placed with the first three and then handed to the spectator. The spectator holds the pieces for a moment and then opens the pieces to find a TOTALLY RESTORED SIGNED CARD !! Please add $4.95 s/h. "ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL TO WATCH" Money Order or Cashiers Check ships your item within 24 hours. Personal Check accepted but will delay shipping of your item. Payment must be received within 10 days of the end of the auction. Shipping & Handling to be paid by winning bidder, insurance extra. Please see description. Please CLICK HERE to look at my other auctions. Thank You and Good Luck! Interfacing is a light-weight non-woven fabric that's used to give GREAT BODY AND SHAPE to your sewing projects, like collars, cuffs, jacket lapels, pockets, zippered areas, waistbands, or just to give an extra layer of body to fabrics, etc, etc, etc! With this fusible version, all you do is iron-it on to the "wrong" side (back) of your fabric, fusible-dots side down! This interfacing is suitable for Light to Medium Weight fabrics! CONVENIENT AND EASY-TO-USE because it IRONS-ON! Please read all stipulations below, if you cannot honor or abide by them, do not waste our time or yours. We do not enjoy giving negatives or receiving threatening mail about an impending negative or non paying bidder process, but to be fair we have guidelines that we follow and make perfectly clear in our auctions. I really regret having to implement these stipulations in our auctions, but irresponsible bidders and timewasters have made it necessary. Those buyers who do not seem to understand that we do not take checks also have made this necessary. For those of you who are responsible bidders, who read the entire auction before they bid, please know that this is not aimed at you and that we welcome you and your purchase. I have met a lot of really nice courteous bidders and sellers here and hope to keep meeting you all in the future. For you repeat buyers, thank you for your trust in me and I really do value your business. 1. we use a set shipping and insurance fee . This fee will take in oversize boxes if this pertains to the auction, and delivery confirmation and insurance on all items. It does also include a handling fee in the amount which will take care of our expenses in getting the item to you safe and sound, extra insurance and sales tax. We try very hard to be as close to the shipping and insurance as we can,but still allow extra for the above. Shipping will be on the Saturday after payment is recieved. There are some countries that do not allow insurance and therefore we are not able to send to this country. 2. . I do reserve the right to not accept bids from those with negative feed-back ; history of non payment; late payments; lack of communications or unreasonable demands or retractions. If you snipe at the last minute, we will hold to these same standards and may not honor your bid for the same reasons. All bidders are held to the same standards to be fair. Regardless of feedback or buyer/seller status. 3. Payment is fine money order or cashier check. We are no longer taking checks. If you send a check, it will NOT be considered payment and will either be destroyed or returned with your merchandise upon proper payment. We also take paypal payments from verified accounts which unfortunately does not include other countries at present. You would send to momahedger@aol.com. 4. We do participate in the NPB process. 5. I leave feedback when I know that the buyer has recieved their item. I do not need for the buyer to leave it first, but I do need to know that the item has arrived. I rate my buyers on their payment, on their communication with us during and after the auction and their reading and following our guidelines in the auction. Many sellers do it different. As soon as I know that the item has arrived I will go and leave feedback . Ruby Lane Antiques & Collectibles

Items.Name: Avon Snuggly Mouse Candle Holder W/ Box 1983
Items.Description: This early Avon item was produced in 1983. It is a Ceramic candle holder of a mouse cuddled up in an xmas stocking, next to a pot belly stove. The candle holder comes with a candle but as can be seen in the photos, heat has caused it to curve a bit and it received a scratch that has removed some of the red color. The candle holder itself is in excellent condition. While it has never been used, you will find some candle shaving in it as I pushed the candle in for the pictures. The box has been in storage for several years but as it was on the top, it is still in excellent condition with it's full gloss.. If you are interested in figural Avon Decanters/bottles be sure to look at the other items offered as I have several others up for bids. High bidder to pay shipping and insurance. Items.Name: DAVIS EMBOSSED OPEN PONTIL MEDICINE BOTTLE
Items.Description: Here is a classic open pontiled aqua medicine bottle. It is 5 1/8 inches tall and has 3 sunken panels. It is embossed: DAVIS arched in a recessed square on the front and VEGETABLE on left side and PAIN KILLER on the other side. Has a nice applied double collar and beveled edges. Similar to Greer's but this size not listed. Digger Odell states in his book, Pontil Medicine Encyclopedia, that Perry Davis was a carpenter and discovered this formula and began selling this medicine in a basket-What a change in occupations. Digger does not list this size either. This medicine was also referred to in the classic novel of Tom Sawyer. The condition is good-it is dug with a nice haze. No chips, dings or cracks in the glass. The glass is crude and has wonderful whittle. The base is the real odd feature-has a horseshoe type key mold, an x on each side with a nice open pontil in the center. Would make a nice addition to any Early pre-civil war or Pontiled Medicine bottle collection. No reserve. Thank you for looking at this item and God Bless. Click on a picture to enlarge ') //-- ') //-- ') //-- Free Honesty Counters powered by Andale! Payment Details See item description and Payment Instructions, or contact seller for more information. Items.Name: Old Metal 4 Pc Canister Set w/Old Pictures !!
Items.Description: This is a really nice old metal 4 piece Canister Set. It has old pictures on it. There is a flour, sugar, Coffee, and tea canister. The flour and sugar cansiters are 8 1/2 inches x 5 1/2 inches wide and are 4 1/2 inches deep. The coffee and tea canisters are 4 1/2 inches by 5 1/2 inches wide and 4 1/2 inches deep. They can be stacked on top of each other. The flour one has Golden Harvest Brand Bleached Flour, Milled from Choice Grain and Quality Since 1903 on the front of it. The opposite sides have a Big Picture of a Bundle of Wheat on it with the words Golden Harvest at the top and Milled form Choice Grain Bleached, Quality since 1903 under the picture. The sugar canister has Crystal Cane Brand Refined Brown Sugar Natural Pure Cane Sugar and Quality since 1903 on the front of it. On the opposite sides it has a picture of 3 men in a sugar cane field harvesting the sugar cane. The words Crystal Cane Brand and Refined Brown at the top of the picture and Pure Cane Sugar at the bottom of the picture. The coffee canister has Columbian Grown Coffee, New Dawn Coffee, Fine Ground, and Quality since 1903 on the front of it. On the two opposite sides there is a picture of a coffee grinder with a sack of coffee beans beside it with a scoop sticking out of it on it with the words New Dawn Brand above it. The tea canister has Amber Blend Brand Tea, Finest Select Oriental Teas, and Quality since 1903 on the front of it. On the two opposite sides there is a picture of a viking-style ship on the sea with land and a large oriental building in the background of the ship. The words Amber Blend Brand above the picture and Finest Select Oriental Teas under the picture. All have the Chein Industries, Inc. 1977, 1978 on the bottom of one side in small print. They are copper brown in color and have pretty, old-fashion-like designs on the tops of them. They are in great condition. The winning bidder will pay $9.95 Shipping and Handling and $1.10 Insurance. Don't miss out on this exceptionally nice Old Metal Canisters! To insure delivery before the Holidays, why not purchase them with the Buy it Now Option! HAPPY BIDDING !!
